comments.author: paulgmiller
comments.body: Hmm in manually testing seems to take -rawoutput but I don't see it in the help.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Trying to understand the use case of why someone would use this instead of just `invoke-webrequest` if they want to parse it themselves?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Yeah, this seems like redundant behavior on top of `Invoke-WebRequest` to me. Both `HtmlWebResponseObject` (in Windows PowerShell) and `BasicHtmlWebResponseObject` (in PowerShell Core) contain the `RawContent` property, and `Invoke-WebRequest` supports all the same web request methods. 

@paulgmiller Do you have a scenario where `Invoke-WebRequest` doesn't fulfill your needs?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
Waiting on a response to:
>@paulgmiller Do you have a scenario where `Invoke-WebRequest` doesn't fulfill your needs?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Closing because of no response.  Please re-open with an answer.  Thanks

title: Add raw output to invoke-restmethod for when you don't want any parsing.
